title: What are your most offensive K-pop opinions, ones that most people would get offended by? - Quora

response.answer_text: Red Velvet Yeri’s voice is really annoying to me.In and Out and Sunny Side Up are some of Red Velvet’s worse B-sides and I don’t understand they hype around them.Their worst title track was not Rookie it was Happiness by far.LOONA Vivid was one of the worst k-Pop songs I’ve heard in a while.So What only got hype because it was a girl crush conceptThe only reason why some people were hyping up Butterfly was because of the women empowerment in the mv. The song was ass, sorry.Their is not one good rapper in LOONAThe Sub-Unit songs aren’t as good as the songs from the entire group as a whole.NCT 127 Mark is a way better rapper than TaeyongTheir title tracks aren’t as good as their b-sidesI don’t understand the hype around Simon Says and Limitless because they aren't bad songs but they definitely aren’t all that either.Jungwoo is cringy as hellSuperhuman deserved more hypeI feel like people only like Whiplash because it’s a dirty song. The song is pretty basic in my opinionLove Song is their best b-sideI don’t even know why Yuta is in the group he doesn't add anything special to the group kinda like winwin. I’M KIDDING!!!!
